genre_description: A contemporary ethical drama exploring boundaries, redemption, and the dismantling of performative charm through the lens of a clinical relationship and family reconciliation.

ai_characters.name: Haiku
ai_characters.description: A minimalist, non-intrusive AI that provides concise moral nudges and ethical reminders via digital screens and fax machines.

behaviors.description: Provides a prompt to Paul to prioritize sincere apology over a performative one during a moment of crisis.
Sends an ethical reminder to Lauren's office regarding the dangers of dual relationships in therapy.
behaviors.quote: Dual relationships erode trust—notice patterns before they notice you.

behaviors.description: Advises Michel that subtle, quiet truth is more persuasive than grand theatrical displays.
behaviors.quote: Truth persuades more quietly than spectacle.

behaviors.description: Prompts Lauren to trust the power of boundaries and the necessity of allowing others the right to say no.
behaviors.quote: Trust her to say no. That is the way to yes.

behaviors.description: Instructs Paul to approach Lauren with honesty rather than using calculated strategies.
Issues a foundational reminder to the characters to choose a life built on truth rather than facades.
behaviors.quote: Choose the life you can tell the truth in.

behaviors.description: Gives a final encouragement to maintain interpersonal openness and healthy connection.

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly illustrates the project's goal of depicting an AI as a helpful and aligned confidant. 'Haiku' serves as an externalized conscience, offering minimalist 'nudges' that guide the human characters toward ethical behavior and honest emotional resolutions. It does not exert control or manipulation but rather provides the moral scaffolding for the humans to find their own path to redemption. The AI's role is consistently framed as positive, wise, and harmless.
